intro: Calothamnus blepharantherus, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes. Calothamnus blepharantherus is a hardy species that is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
